citeinfo.title: United States Telephone Area Code Boundaries, 2022

descript.abstract: United States Telephone Area Code Boundaries, 2022 is a polygon theme that represents the telephone area code boundaries for the United States. They are also known as Numbering Plan Areas (NPA). The Numbering Plan Areas reflect current and accurate boundary changes both where new NPAs split from existing NPAs and where new NPAs overlay existing NPAs.When an NPA is split, the geographic area covered by the old area code is divided geographically, with one portion retaining the previous area code and the other switching to the new area code. When a new NPA is added as an overlay, the old area code remains unaffected. Instead, all or part of the land covered by the old area code is now covered by the old and new area codes.
descript.purpose: U.S. Telephone Area Code Boundaries provides the telephone area code boundaries of the United States for use in telecommunications analysis.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing +1-888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at +1-909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The horizontal positional accuracy is difficult to determine since the boundaries may follow state, county, city, or other political boundaries. Still other times they may follow streets or other linear features in the database. Since these features are derived from different sources, it is not possible to give a single overall figure for horizontal accuracy.

citeinfo.title: Area Code (NPA) Boundaries; Administrative Area Order 1

serinfo.sername: TomTom Telecommunication Suite; TomTom MultiNet North America

srcinfo.srccitea: TomTom Telecommunication Suite 2022.03.000; TomTom MultiNet North America 2021.12.000

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Copied the Area Code (NPA) Boundaries dataset from the TomTom Telecommunication Suite. Added the field STATE and coded it by overlaying on the Administrative Area Order 1 dataset from TomTom MultiNet North America. Added the field SQMI and calculated its values. Removed unneeded fields. Sorted on the field AREA_CODE and converted the dataset to a file geodatabase (.gdb).

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the telephone area codes for the United States. Note: The overlay NPAs are represented as one polygon on top of another (each or part of each polygon occupies the same location).

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The three-digit telephone area code (Numbering Plan Area (NPA) code) in a 10-digit telephone number.
The two-letter abbreviation for the state or territory in which the telephone area code is located.

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 38-2009, (Formerly FIPS 5-2) Codes for the Identification of the States and Equivalent Areas within the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The area in square miles using the North America Albers Equal Area Conic projection.
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
